item.title: Overflowing bins at 41 Narford Road, 21st February
item.description:
Previously reported on 25th October 2025. Recent renovations at 41 Narford Road have left no space for the bins within the boundaries of the property. Residents permanently store their bins on the pavement. The bins are often overflowing with food waste.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Narford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus Stop Kentish Town (Stop KF), 21st February
item.description:
The property at 369–377 Kentish Town Road, London, Camden, NW5 2TJ currently has a temporary construction wall in place which significantly narrows the pavement at Bus Stop Kentish Town (Stop KF). During peak times, large numbers of passengers waiting for the bus effectively block the remaining pavement, making it very difficult for pedestrians to pass. Even during off-peak times, when only a few people are waiting, there is insufficient space for pushchairs or wheelchairs to pass safely. The situation is particularly problematic during rainy weather: as the bus stop has no shelter, both waiting passengers and passing pedestrians use umbrellas, which further reduces the already limited space. At the same time, stepping into the carriageway to get around the crowd is not a viable option, as the road is frequently flooded (see FixMyStreet reference 8113955, which was submitted by another resident and where it was decided that no further action would be taken). Could the bus stop be temporarily relocated slightly towards 379 Kentish Town Road, where there appears to be more space for passengers to wait? Even moving the stop a few yards further north, towards the gate in the construction wall, would provide slightly more space for passengers while waiting and improve pedestrian flow. Alternatively, could the construction wall be adjusted to provide a wider pavement? There does not appear to have been any visible construction activity at this site for the past six months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Town Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
